content:
Name the elements in the following reaction that have been
oxidized and reduced, respectively: Zn + CuSO  ZnSO + Cu
(solid) 4(aqueous) 4(aqueous) (solid)
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: OXIDIZED = Zn (ACCEPT: ZINC); REDUCED = Cu (ACCEPT: COPPER)

content:
Which of the following is closest to the pK of an acid whose
a
K = 5.0 × 10–4:
a
W) 2.3
X) 3.3
Y) 4.0
Z) 5.0
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following best describes the repressor protein in the
lac (read as: LACK) operon:
W) uncompetitive inhibitor
X) structural protein
Y) regulatory protein
Z) transcriptional factor
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Through which of the following mechanisms do allosteric
inhibitors typically operate:
W) binding the substrate
X) binding to an enzyme’s active site
Y) binding to a site other than the active site and changing the shape of an enzyme
Z) acting as a competitive inhibitor and overpowering the active sites of enzymes
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: Y) BINDING TO A SITE OTHER THAN THE ACTIVE SITE AND CHANGINGTHE SHAPE OF AN ENZYMEHigh School Round 14 Page 1

content:
In the radioactive decay scheme of uranium, what is the final stable
element produced?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Consider an astronaut on the Moon and g is exactly 1/6th of g on Earth.
If he threw an object vertically upwards with an initial velocity of 1.6 meters per second, how many
meters up would it be after 1 second, rounding your answer to the first decimal place?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Which of the following represents the inverse function of f(x) = x3 + 5:
W) (x – 5)3
X) x3 – 5
1
Y) (x−5)3
3
 1 
Z)  
x−5
1
subject: MATH

content:
Giving your answer in meters squared, find the total surface area of a
right prism whose base is a right triangle with legs of length 3 meters and 4 meters and whose
altitude is 2 meters:
subject: MATH
answer: 36(Solution: 3:4:5; P = 3+4+5 = 12m; A = ½bh = 6 m2; TA = LA + 2B = (12)(2) + 2(6) = 36 m2)baseHigh School Round 14 Page 2

content:
Which of the following is a tree that is very well-adapted to
surviving above shallow permafrost:
W) cottonwood
X) white pine
Y) aspen
Z) black spruce
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following BEST describes a small lake in an
arctic environment that is likely to be surrounded by a ring of so-called drunken trees leaning toward
the lake:
W) paternoster lake
X) thermokarst
Y) tarn
Z) fen
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Order the following 3 hexadecimal numbers from
SMALLEST to LARGEST: 3E8; BB8; 1F4;
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
An experiment aboard a recent Space Shuttle mission
exposed Salmonella typhimurium (read as: TIE-fee-muhr-EE-um) to a space environment. Which of
the following resulted when the bacteria came back to Earth:
W) they were more virulent
X) they were less virulent
Y) they had about the same virulence
Z) they changed into a new but similar species of bacteria
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: W) THEY WERE MORE VIRULENT(Solution: NASA’s Space Shuttle mission STS-115)High School Round 14 Page 3

content:
Which of the following is TRUE of red supergiants:
W) some form Cepheid variables
X) most end as nova stars
Y) most have luminosities about 10 to 100 times that of our Sun
Z) most have surface temperatures at least 2-times that of our Sun
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
Which of the following is NOT characteristic of B-type stars
like Rigel or Spica (read as: SPY-kah):
W) very luminous
X) apparent blue color
Y) medium strength hydrogen spectral lines
Z) average solar mass of about 3.2
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: Z) AVERAGE SOLAR MASS OF ABOUT 3.2(Solution: solar mass of about 16-18)

content:
According to VSEPR bonding theory, if 2 of the bonded atoms
in an octahedral molecule are replaced by 2 electron pairs, the molecule will assume what geometric
shape, such as in XeF :
4
W) linear
X) trigonal bipyramidal
Y) square planar
Z) square pyramidal
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
According to VSEPR bonding theory, if one of the bonded
atoms in a trigonal bipyramidal molecule is replaced by 2 electron pairs, the molecule will assume
what geometric shape, such as in ClF :
3
W) t-shaped
X) see-saw
Y) linear
Z) bent
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following mutations would most likely affect a gene
the LEAST:
W) single base deletion
X) single base substitution
Y) single base insertion
Z) quadruple base deletion
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following BEST explains why a single base
substitution in a gene-coding region for amino acids will sometimes lead to no change in amino acid
sequence:
W) all nucleotides are subject to the same mutation rate
X) some nucleotide bases are covalently joined by stronger bonds
Y) the code is degenerate with more than one triplet coding for the same amino acid
Z) some amino acids act in the same fashion in determining the tertiary structure of a protein
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: Y) THE CODE IS DEGENERATE WITH MORE THAN ONE TRIPLET CODINGFOR THE SAME AMINO ACID

content:
Which of the following experimental approaches was used by
scientists to discover that the atomic nucleus held most of the atom’s mass and a positive charge:
W) directing alpha particles at thin metal strips
X) finding the amount of magnetic deflection in cathode rays within a well-evacuated tube
Y) exposing photographic film to certain radium salts
Z) using a crude cyclotron to disintegrate large nuclei
subject: PHYSICS
answer: W) DIRECTING ALPHA PARTICLES AT THIN METAL STRIPS

content:
Name all of the following 4 sub-atomic particles that are never found
in isolation: electrons; protons; quarks; positrons
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Which of the following is a quadratic equation with a root of
multiplicity of 2:
W) 9x2 – 30x2 + 25 = 0
X) x2 + 2x – 15 = 0
Y) 6x2 – 11x – 2 = 0
Z) 4x2 – 1 = 0
subject: MATH

content: Given f(x) = x2 + 2x + 3, express f(x + 1) in standard polynomial form:
subject: MATH

content:
Placodonts, which lived during the Triassic Period, were a
group of:
W) meat-eating land reptiles
X) flying reptiles
Y) small, lightweight, plant-eating reptiles
Z) marine reptiles
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is NOT true regarding seismic
waves through the Earth:
W) P-waves travel through the mantle
X) S-waves travel through the mantle
Y) P-waves travel through the outer core
Z) S-waves travel through the outer core
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: Z) S-WAVES TRAVEL THROUGH THE OUTER CORE(Solution: S-waves cannot travel through liquids and the outer core is liquid)High School Round 14 Page 6

content:
Which of the following would a Leyden jar most likely be
considered:
W) an electroscope
X) a capacitor
Y) a resistor
Z) a Tesla cage
subject: PHYSICS

content:
How many joules of energy are used by an electrical appliance
operating on 8 amps of current flowing through a 20-ohm resistance circuit for 5 minutes?
subject: PHYSICS
answer: 384,000(Solution: E = I2 R × T = (8A)2 × 20 ohms × 300 s = 384,000 joules)

content:
Which of the following BEST describes where the zodiacal
light is brightest to a stargazer at mid-northern latitudes:
W) within about 20 degrees of the ecliptic
X) at the western horizon at sunrise
Y) at right angles to the Milky Way
Z) parallel with the Milky Way
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: W) WITHIN ABOUT 20 DEGREES OF THE ECLIPTIC

content:
Which of the following is the BEST explanation for what
causes zodiacal light:
W) reflection of moonlight off the Earth’s surface
X) dispersion of the Earth’s radiant heat off the troposphere
Y) sunlight reflected off interplanetary dust particles
Z) radiation from the Van Allen belts
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: Y) SUNLIGHT REFLECTED OFF INTERPLANETARY DUST PARTICLESHigh School Round 14 Page 7

content:
How many quantum numbers are required to completely describe
a specific electron in a multi-electron atom?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following describes the quantum number that
indicates the direction in space of the electron cloud surrounding the nucleus of an atom:
W) magnetic quantum number
X) principle quantum number
Y) angular momentum quantum number
Z) spin quantum number
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following BEST explains why leaves fall off trees in
the autumn:
W) the leaves die and passively fall off
X) an abscission layer forms at the base of the leaf stem causing it to fall off
Y) the leaves slowly dry out from the bottom up because of abscisic acid that prevents phloem from
delivering nutrients
Z) the vascular tissue of the leaves fill up with resin increasing their stiffness and causing them to
become brittle
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: X) AN ABSCISSION LAYER FORMS AT THE BASE OF THE LEAF STEMCAUSING IT TO FALL OFF

content:
Which of the following will most likely result from a single base
deletion in DNA:
W) nonsense mutation
X) stop codon
Y) frame shift mutation
Z) inversion mutation
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: Y) FRAME SHIFT MUTATIONHigh School Round 14 Page 8

content:
Because of its linear-temperature relationship and its
chemical inertness, which of the following materials is almost always used in resistance temperature
detectors:
W) mercury
X) platinum
Y) iron
Z) brass
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is the main advantage for the
use of geothermal heat pumps in the U.S.:
W) geothermal steam reservoirs can be tapped almost anywhere in the U.S.
X) heat can be delivered directly for its intended use
Y) steam can be used to directly generate electricity
Z) all areas of the U.S. have nearly constant shallow-ground temperatures
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: Z) ALL AREAS OF THE U.S. HAVE NEARLY CONSTANT SHALLOW-GROUNDTEMPERATURES

content:
In the algebra of real-valued functions, give the name or number of all of
the following 3 choices that the implied domain usually excludes:
1) numbers causing division by zero
2) numbers causing imaginary numbers in the range
3) numbers causing irrational numbers in the range
subject: MATH

content:
Add the following rational expressions and give your answer in fully
x 4x
factored form: +
(x+2) (x−6)
x(5x+2) x(5x+2)
subject: MATH

content: The aurora occur high in what layer of Earth’s atmosphere?
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
During a Nor’easter, areas far to the east of the storm
center will feel which of the following storm-generated winds:
W) northeasterly
X) southeasterly
Y) southwesterly
Z) northwesterly
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following most accurately represents the
complete range of wavelengths to which the human eye is sensitive:
W) 320 to 600 nanometers
X) 380 to 740 nanometers
Y) 450 to 850 nanometers
Z) 480 to 950 nanometers
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is NOT true:
W) over 50% of all stars that appear to be single are double or multiple systems
X) aurora borealis can occur in all 4 seasons
Y) tetanus toxin causes muscle stiffness in affected humans
Z) the Large Hadron Collider at CERN began colliding electrons in September of 2008
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: Z) THE LARGE HADRON COLLIDER AT CERN BEGAN COLLIDINGELECTRONS IN SEPTEMBER OF 2008(Solution: the LHA collides hadrons…electrons are leptons)High School Round 14 Page 10

content:
If the surface temperature of a star increased from 6,000 kelvin
to 18,000 kelvin, how many times as much energy would it radiate?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
Using the most common temperature-based spectral
classification system, a star with an apparent color of blue and a surface temperature of 55,000
kelvin would have what spectral letter classification?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
What is the most common name for the terminus of a tRNA
molecule to which amino acids are attached?
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: 3-PRIME TERMINUS (ACCEPT: CCA 3-PIME END or 3-PRIME END or3-PRIME)

content:
What protein, that takes its name from its apparent molecular weight,
can arrest cells in the G1-S checkpoint, initiate apoptosis (read as: aye-pop-TOE-sis) and, when
deactivated, is implicated in a wide variety of cancers?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
According to general solubility rules, name all of the following 5
substances that are NOT soluble in water:
lithium iodide; sodium chloride; iron(II) hydroxide; sodium nitrate; barium sulfate
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Consider a hypothetical reaction, A + B  C + D. At zero time,
the concentration of A = 1 molar, after 30 seconds A = 0.5 molar, and after 50 seconds A = 0.3
molar. Calculate the average rate of disappearance of A over the time interval 30 seconds to 50
seconds, in molarity per second:
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
What is the most common name for the field, which is believed to act
somewhat like a fluid that fills space and endows quarks with mass?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Order the following 3 isotopes from the one with the LOWEST
nuclear binding energy to the HIGHEST: iron-58; hydrogen-2; oxygen-16
subject: PHYSICS
answer: HYDROGEN-2; OXYGEN-16; IRON-58High School Round 14 Page 12

content:
Into what specific mitochondrial compartment are hydrogen ions
pumped out during chemiosmosis (read as: chem-ee-oz-MOE-sis)?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Name all of the following 4 hormones that are formed primarily
from the amino acid tyrosine: glucagon; thyroxine; epinephrine; erythropoietin (read as: EE-rith-
roe-POE-ih-tin)
subject: BIOLOGY
